rV1.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6f6d275f7b1b7a25fbd042b054278301fd1770789e55e7a318ca97ca4b55f362","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://83a00e6f746fbac5d5424ad82db1df721a99709ba90af1f18aa09c37e8c9ca55","dweb:/ipfs/QmUbpm6GhJRvHLG78TTj1vcoPupwBaYu5vXGzA3k8CxGsr"]}},"version":1}

claim(uint64,address,uint256,bytes32[]).details: Can only claim once per round per address

params.merkleProof: Merkle proof to verify the claim

returns._0: True if the address has claimed for this round

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.to: Address to receive the rescued tokens

setRoot(bytes32,uint64).details: Allows updating multiple times within the same round

params.newRoot: New Merkle root for claim verification
params.newRound: New round number (must be >= current round)

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

claim(uint64,address,uint256,bytes32[]).notice: Claims tokens for an address using a Merkle proof

isClaimed(uint64,address).notice: Checks if an address has claimed for a specific round

rescue(address,uint256).notice: Owner can rescue leftover tokens after the claim window

s_merkleRoot().notice: Current Merkle root for claim verification

setRoot(bytes32,uint64).notice: Sets a new Merkle root and round for claims

documentation.text: @notice Error thrown when root is set to zero
@notice Error thrown when attempting to set a round backwards
@notice Error thrown when claim amount doesn't match REWARD_AMOUNT
@notice Error thrown when address has already claimed for this round
@notice Error thrown when claiming for wrong round
@notice Error thrown when Merkle proof verification fails
@notice Error thrown when token transfer fails
@notice ERC20 token being distributed
@notice Fixed reward amount per claim
@notice Current Merkle root for claim verification
@notice Current distribution round
@notice Mapping of round => address => claimed status
@notice Useful to add state variables in new versions of the contract
